sen.e: The fact that Sakai Prefecture was incorporated into Osaka Prefecture in 1881 was seen as one of the consequences of Haihan-chiken, yet, from the national level, the work had been completed; therefore, it was more about the merge in the midst of the problem associated with partition for prefectures that were too big (in reality, after the merge of Sakai Prefecture, there have been no cases where the administrative divisions of Japan have been abolished, apart from the reorganization of Hokkaido and the temporary abolition of the Okinawa Prefecture due to the military polices implemented by the US military after the Pacific War).
